title: Topological divisor of zero
summary: In mathematics, an element z {\displaystyle z} of a Banach algebra A {\displaystyle A} is called a topological divisor of zero if there exists a sequence x 1 , x 2 , x 3 , . . . {\displaystyle x_{1},x_{2},x_{3},...} of elements of A {\displaystyle A} such that
